Calculate Residuals for a `reReg' Fit

Source: R/residuals.R
residuals.reReg.Rd

Calculates residuals for a joint frailty scale-change model fitted by `reReg`. Under the recurrent event model, at each observation time, \(t\), the residual is calculated as $$\mbox{observed number of recurrent events at } t- \mbox{expected number of recurrent events at} t.$$ The expected number of recurrent events at \(t\) is calculated by the cumulative rate function at \(t\). Under the failure time model, the residual is calculated as $$\Delta - H(t),$$ where \(\Delta\) is the terminal event indicator and \(H(t)\) is the cumulative hazard function at \(t\).

# S3 method for reReg
residuals(object, model = c("recurrent", "failure"), ...)

Arguments

object

an object of class reReg returned by the reReg() function.

model

a character string specifying whether the residuals will be calculated under the recurrent event model or the failure time model.

...

additional parameters for future development.

Contents
